website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot Elph 520 HS is a good choice for those already happy with their smartphone's photos and movie clips, but looking for a cute little camera with a long zoom and faster performance.
pros: The Canon PowerShot Elph 520 HS is a good-looking camera that's remarkably compact for its 12x zoom lens
cons: The 520 HS' button layout takes some adjusting to, its battery life is relatively short, and its photo and movie quality are disappointing given the camera's price tag

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera due to the small size. I was looking for a camera to take to stand up shows and concerts. Last night i got to test it our at a stand up comedy show with low lights. The zoom was great and the pictures turned out great. With full zoom, auto focus and auto settings, low indoor light, no flash, i could not asked for a better picture, every shot turned out great, good lighting and no blur. Glad i picked this little camera up, great size, outstanding zoom and great picture quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gamehendge

customer_reviews.title: Love the Quality of the Pictures
customer_reviews.text: This was a great value. I love the quality of the photos. The only frustration is slow response in taking pictures when lighting and conditions are not perfect. The camera takes the shot when it gets good and ready! The other negative is the low battery life. The camera comes with a battery charger but be prepared to charge the battery often. Regardless, the quality of the shots make this a great value. Also of note was the great customer service I was provided as a result of some issues surrounding my transaction: Without going into great detail, I just want to say, Amazon really care about their customers and strive to make them happy. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Ms B

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera, missing a few features I'd have liked
customer_reviews.text: I may update this review as I learn more about the camera. First of all, let me get the main thing out of the way which I'm sure is so important to the rest of you as it was to me...:) IT"S BLUE! And wow is it ever pretty! This design is sleek, gorgeous and very snazzy. The pictures it takes are almost too clear, I see lines and blemishes even the mirror won't show me in these pics. Am I really that old looking in hd?!! Thank goodness for the blur feature...though I haven't figured that out yet. It's a great little camera, though I found later you can find as good for cheaper, but ah well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: For those complaining about the micro-sd card...
customer_reviews.text: Yes the micro card IS tiny. So is this wonderful camera. The tiny size is why you want this camera I put a 16 gb class 10 card (around $20) in and just leave it. When it is time to download I just plug up the USB cable and go. I do the same with my 7d DSLR. I shot 600 pics and several movies over spring break in Fla and only used half the capacity. There is no reason to be pulling the card out for downloads. JUST LEAVE THE CARD WITHIN AND ENJOY THE TINY POCKET ELPH.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie Fan

customer_reviews.title: Takes great pictures for its size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a couple of reasons. First, to take family pictures. Our old compact camera died after 10 years, so we needed a new one. Second, I'm a commercial real estate broker and sometimes need pictures of properties. I don't list a lot of properties, but when I do I need to take pictures. I have used this camera for both purposes over the last month and it has performed really nicely. The pictures come out very clear, lots of detail. My wife's SLR camera is superior, but for the size and price I'm extremely pleased with this. If you read the manual before using, everything is easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: One of the best in a long line of power shots we've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Takes fabulous pictures. We've had Powershots for years, and love the cameras. This one takes the best pics yet, and is lightweight, simple (very similar to previous in menu and design). I read all the reviews on here, and took the advice of one of the camera guys who gave a very thorough review of all the recent models. I haven't been disappointed at all. Love this camera. Did buy a couple extra batteries, and the 32gb card. I was worried at first that it might not be enough, until I checked my iPhoto library, and it only has 16 gb of photos in it. Guess that the card will be adequate. LOL
customer_reviews.author: doodlebug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better camera than my previous generation Canon. It is smaller, more versatile, higher resolution (10M) and has great zoom capability. The battery is a special Canon rechargeable, NB-9L, quickly revived by included recharger. They are cheap so I usually carry a second fresh battery, but rarely need it. I bought an adapter for the tiny (size) memory so that I can put it straight into my computer without using the cable. I can download a huge number of photos quicker that way. The function, display and menu buttons are not intuitive, and take some getting used to, as there are so many options. Overall, a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Poor Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good-looking little camera with great specs and all the bells and whistles. Unfortunately, the copy I got will not take sharp photos, which is a deal-breaker in my opinion. I have other, lower-resolution, cameras that take better photos. Maybe I just got a bad one but every photo lacks sharpness in both auto and manual modes. Maybe it's the lens. Maybe it's a firmware issue but there are no firmware updates. Online forums indicate many owners are happy but some have the same complaint I have. I expected better from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect especially for on the go. I love it. It takes great video as well as captures fantastic stills. We have bought 3 of them. One for my husband, one for my daughter and one for my parents. It's the best compact camera. I am a photographer and it's difficult to always take my SLRs with me especially when riding the motorcycle so this little camera fits the bill. I hope they come out in more colors because I will probably buy another one. I love giving this for a gift. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: slammer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer's Remorse
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to take to Argentina in August. He tested it when it arrived and it worked fine and he liked the features. It worked for the first few weeks after arriving in Argentina, but now it gives an error message every time he turns it on. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rawesome

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love it so much that when someone stole mine off an airplane I'd just left, that I ordered another within 24 hours. I love the size, and, most of all, because I take more video than still pictures, I really like it's video capabilities. I have a Canon HG F10 video camera that I use most of the time, but this little camera when used in tight areas, or as a supplemental video camera is terrific. I've read a few reviews stating that the battery life is short, but seems for video they last very well. (I ordered a couple of replacement batteries off of Amazon (not Canon) they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Foley

customer_reviews.title: Its so tiny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a little vacation I was planning. Then decided I'd never use it and tried to cancel the order but I was to late. I'm glad I opened it up and looked at it before shipping it back because I really like this little guy. It's smaller then an iphone even thought its wider, is definitely the best pocket-point-and-shoot camera I've ever had. Very happy that I didn't return it. Pros Size, weight, quality. Cons Uses Micro Mini SD card, takes a bit to figure out how to use program mode, not USB chargeable
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Smith

customer_reviews.title: Just received new camera
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally broke my FujiFilm camera and was hesitant to replace it because I loved its features. Well, this little camera is amazing! I have only taken about 20 pictures so far, but quality is fantastic. There is a dedicated video button which I really wanted in a camera. Still not sure if you can snap a photo while video is going like my old camera, but all in all it is a good replacement. Buttons are pretty easy to navigate and I love the large LCD screen. I highly recommend keeping the wrist strap on at all times when using a camera this tiny. It is very easy for it to slip out of your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Horse Gal

customer_reviews.title: Such great pictures for a GREAT price!
customer_reviews.text: After my brother bought this camera on a cruise and took fantastic shots- I watched it on Amazon for months! I bought it right before a trip to DC. It is a great size for travel and has a screen to take and review photos. The only thing I don't care for is the tiny memory card. I feel like I could lose track of it quickly. I don't know much about camera settings so use "auto" and have captured great shots. It also videos. You really can't beat the price- I know I said that already but I am extremely pleased with this camera so far.
customer_reviews.author: lovecustomerservice

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to shoot close-up nature shots (ie. birds) while on my stand-up paddleboard. It is small and light enough to fit in my pocket and quickly pull out when the moment presents itself. It seemed like the perfect camera. Theoretically. The reality is, unfortunately, that the picture quality is unimpressive, almost not worth the bother. I gave it two stars for picture quality and one star for its compact design. Doesn't hold a candle to the image quality and features on my Canon 300HS. I absolutely love that camera. Problem is that it only has a 5X zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.S

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the camera for a short time, but love it so far. Perfect, small size and really easy to use. One of my favorite features is the ease of transferring the pictures to my pc. My first real test is coming soon as I ordered my first photo book with pics from the camera. But overall, VERY pleased with this purchase! Update: after receiving my photo book I still love it. The quality of the pictures are amazing! People who see the book can't believe the pics were taken with just my little point-and-shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: kvt5

customer_reviews.title: Smile - You're on Candid Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Powershot Elph. Plenty high enough megapixels, and a great zoom. I am a photographer, with very expensive cameras, but use these Powershot Elphs for casual use while out and about. If you've read any bad reviews about this camera, ignore them. Their complaints are technical bull. It takes great pictures and videos. Get one - snap one up now - especially at this price!
customer_reviews.author: D. T. Harker

customer_reviews.title: Yet another Canon
customer_reviews.text: Just like the little pink bunny...a Canon just keeps on going...this is my 3rd or 4th Canon...I just keep going back to them. My last Canon is still going...I just wanted a new one, a blue one...why just 4 stars? because I never give 5 stars...Nothing is ever perfect, or the best. but this little blue one is very close! Love it...my only problem...the battery goes down very fast compared to my last two canons...but the good thing about that, is the charger that comes w/ it...just plug it in and you've got it back. get'cha one and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: viclyn73

customer_reviews.title: Very clear pictures!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera because we love Canon and our old ones were feeling a little slow. We have a toddler so you can understand needing to get the shot taken as it happens with no time to wait around for the camera to adjust to the light, focus on certain elements and blah blah, whatever it was our other cameras took 5 seconds to do. This one snaps the picture immediately with great quality and we're so happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: TraceyW

customer_reviews.title: skip the deals
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor, order new, skip the deal. Comes without card that is not easy to find. The one suggested Is too big, does not fit this camera.
customer_reviews.author: BarbE

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot ELPH 520 HS 10.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera w/12x Optical
customer_reviews.text: It's an easy camera to use, the pictures so far have been crisp and clear. I'm still getting use to it, but I do like the fact that the camera seems to correct pictures with the stabilizer feature. The only thing I would change in it so far is the batteries. I do like a camera that uses regular double "A" batteries more. It saves time on charging, and would be a better selling point on cameras to offer the double "A" batteries instead of the constant feature of a camera that you need to charge with an expensive battery. That would be the only thing I would change, other than that I find it a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Digital Camera!
customer_reviews.text: OK i ordered this Digital Camera for 40% of the work i do, this Digital Camera works great and the picture quality is 10 (MEGAPIXELS) and i have got to say that this camera takes Cristal clear pictures!!, overall this camera is small with a big bright screen and very nice looking, the video quality is great at 1080p, the only down side of this camera is that the battery dies fast(30min) , this problem can be easily fixed by getting a better battery for it, Amazon sells those battery for a great price, any ways great camera , it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Williams Jean

customer_reviews.title: Just right for me!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a point and shoot camera to replace mine, which was taken in a burglary of my home. This one is just right for me! I was able to get it up and going in minutes and it takes beautiful, clear, sharp pictures on the go! If you are looking for a simple, compact camera for capturing the moments of your children or grandchildren's lives, or to record vacation and family fun quickly so that you don't miss any of the experiences yourself, this is a great little camera!
customer_reviews.author: LJo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small camera to bring with me on motorcycle trips. I was able to shoot some amazing pictures while riding out west! This camera works great for outdoor shots that do not need a flash. I still have not found a setting I like for indoor photos yet...the flash is not very powerful for distance. I will keep playing around with it until I get the desired results. I love that it uses lithium batteries rather than regular AA batteries. I'm sure once I am familiar with all the features I will rate it a 5 stars! Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnique

customer_reviews.title: This little camera is awesome.. Its a point and shoot packed with ...
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is awesome..Its a point and shoot packed with loads of options for a more advanced person..It takes awesome pics and videos, Just make sure you want something small, cause it is all of that. Ive read complaints about noise and weak flash, but if your not an advanced photo person, you wont notice it. The only valid complaint I see, is the battery life,,I bought two extra and that cures the prob for me.
customer_reviews.author: rjs

customer_reviews.title: small and still AWESOME CANON point and shoot. WOW
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME seller and product, both are AAAAAAA+ they got what you need, buy it from them I say! product works AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: HHO

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: tiny, great picture quality. if you are lazy like me and don't want to carry a big camera, and always make your wife carry your camera, this camera will fit in the shirt pocket and u won't even know about it. PICTURE QUALITY IS AWSOME. I can always vouch for cannon. i can buy a 5 megapixel in a cannon camera and know that its better than 12 mp in a nikon or any other camera which are similar to the cameraat least 100 dollars more in the market. BUY IT. AND YOU WILL BE HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: Mahbubul Maruf

customer_reviews.title: Supposedly Discontinued
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first 520 Elph about 2 years ago via Costco and fell in love with it's size, accuracy, ease of use, and long battery life. I use it professionally every day. I tried four other brands that all failed to meet my needs. The Elph surpased them, so that is why I bought a backup already. Fantastic product. I issue 50 page inspection reports and typically prodce 150 photos per report. The Elph more than met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: JD Grewell

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Actually had to return this camera because it would not focus periodically. (refund only-Boo) I ordered another from B/H and it works very well. I would give this camera five stars if it was in a "full-metal jacket". It focuses quickly and most pictures are sharp. Not sure about the image stabilization but long-range shoots do yield pretty good results for a cheap camera. You want to document on the fly? This camera will do it. It replaces my old Cannon SD1200IS. The advances are clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera for more than a year. It takes fantastic photos!! I couldn't take a bad picture even when I try. Takes great shots in low light, hardly ever (never?) use the flash, though it has a mode where it would take two pictures back to back one with and one without the flash. It has a great zoom capability and a great stabilizer. Super light and pretty sturdy. I carry it everywhere I go, in my purse or in my pocket. Like I said, it made a good photographer out of me! I am going to keep it until it stops working, hopefully for a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: NAVLE

customer_reviews.title: This camera is not so bad especially if you want to create mini video projects ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is not so bad especially if you want to create mini video projects or to simply take pictures with. **does NOT come with SD card Pros: the quality, options for screen Cons: battery life, maximum time to use for recording Unfortunately, I can't give a full five stars for this product because someone stole it from me. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Viloria

customer_reviews.title: Good zoom, but needs higher resolution and more robustness
customer_reviews.text: Second day I used the camera on a 3-week trip and it got dropped. Screen got multiple cracks, but still worked. Have had several previous similar Canon cameras, dropped them all a number of times and never cracked a screen. The lens cover looks cool, but the fan blade shaped cover looks delicate. By the end of the 3-weeks of heavy use it would frequently not completely close. Zoom and other features are very nice, but I have to use the Large format setting to get a decent resolution and 2-2.5 MB picture.
customer_reviews.author: Lyman Parkhurst

customer_reviews.title: don't hesitate... buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the older version of the powershot. It's a great durable camera. It most recently survived being banged around for 6 months on a small world jog. It did well from the freezing temps of Beijing, to the wet spring in New Zealand. At one point, the auto-open lens got stuck, but a nice gent in Australia helped me pop it open with a toothpick. The zoom is amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Rosa F

customer_reviews.title: nice big screen
customer_reviews.text: This is really quite a little jewel! So small to carry in my purse, nice big screen, does video beautifully and the photos are GREAT! Good investment!
customer_reviews.author: sewBiz

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera for my Mom very easy for her to use, it zooms in super close, the screen is big enough for her to see, the buttons could be a touch bigger but she could still figure them out even though they were tiny, she easily figured out the battery(love that it only fits one way) and the micro sd slot. She loved the color & took tons of pictures on our vacation something she didn't do with her old camera.
customer_reviews.author: ThymeX

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Canon to replace my Kodak Easyshare that always took blurry photos. So far, I am loving it. Shots are clear, the tracking is a great feature and I'm learning the 'extras' slowly. My favorite is the Color Accent. The size of the camera is a plus and the auto feature does everything it needs to to get the shot right. I would give it 5 stars but some of the features are confusing to either get to or use, otherwise, it is a fabulous purchase for someone looking for an everyday-use camera.
customer_reviews.author: andrea sabino

customer_reviews.title: Super point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Needed a simple to use and not too expensive camera to take on a cruise. The camera took great pictures even without my having to read the instruction manual. I really like how small it is easily fitting into my pants or shirt pocket. Wasn't clear on which sd memory card to buy, ended up ordering the wrong one (needed a micro one).
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Kekstadt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pocketable, or purse, camera. It is very small and light weight. If you want to be as minimalistic as possible but still have more zoom than a camera phone can provide this is the way to go. My only criticism would be it takes noisy pictures at full zoom or in low light. Given the price I think it is an acceptable trade off though.
customer_reviews.author: D. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Takes really sharp pictures
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer and I'm not sure I would notice some of the "unbalanced pixel" stuff other reviewers have complained about. But for me, I got the camera because you can alter the settings manually if you want. However at this point, I've only really taken photos on auto, in all light conditions, and the camera is quite smart! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Musicmaker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent snapshot camera with extra capabilities
customer_reviews.text: This camera is essentially an updated version of the ELPH SD1000. I know this because I also own that camera. This camera has a longer zoom, easier to use macro, and improved automated functions. It uses a microSD card which requires an adapter to mate with a PC. The camera is small, but hefty. Easy to carry and quick to bring to action.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line in digital cameras
customer_reviews.text: This is my second ELPH, the 1st I purchased in 2008. I use a digital camera for work and have tried other brands Canon is by far one of the "best" in the market. Elph takes crystal clear images...awesome editing features, great price for such a professional tool... compact, easy to learn (read the book) love it.
customer_reviews.author: DJdenid

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on our trip to Mexico. I didn't want to pack my SLR everywhere. The quality of the camera and the photos is impressive! With most point and shoot camera bodies being plastic, I was very impressed that the Elph has an all metal body. I love that I can put it in my back pocket! Best small point and shoot camera I've ever used!
customer_reviews.author: HappiGrammy

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, great video, great zoom and great color
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my mom. The picture and video quality is too good, the optical zoom is much better than the standard point & shoot cameras, and the color is amazing. It also has all the goodies of options that canon provides while taking a picture - different modes without configuring much - best suited for my mom who is not a gadget friendly person. She loves it. Yet I can configure the parameters on manual or custom modes.
customer_reviews.author: Pinaki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent auto features
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera. Wanted something that fit easily in my pocket, has good close up resolution and is easy to use. This camera meets all of my wants. I am particularly impressed with the breadth, utility, and functionality of the auto setting I have not had any reason to use the manual settings. The image stabilization is particularly attractive as is the focus lock.
customer_reviews.author: D. Craig

customer_reviews.title: If lighting conditions were perfect than the photos came out great - pretty much ...
customer_reviews.text: If lighting conditions were perfect than the photos came out great - pretty much anything outdoors. Photos indoors, even in very good lighting conditions, produced very fuzzy, unnatural looking photos. People's skin just didn't come out right. In general video quality was very good, but you could hear the motor anytime you zoomed in and out. Also, on occasion it would focus/unfocus repeatedly when taking video. I ended up returning this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Gorka

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great point and shoot camera. Wanted something cheap but sharp to take on a family vacation to Disney. It was small and compact enough to fit in a very small shoulder bag, but takes very nice, sharp, clear pictures. Decent quality night/in-motion pictures as well. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M.

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my photographer husband
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a homerun according to my husband who has a degree in photography. The single best aspect is that the camera easily fits in a pocket, meaning that it is always available. You can capture just about any photo since it has a 12x zoom. One of the best features is being able to zoom in the details of the photo as you view it in the camera. Takes photos in all kinds of light without the flash. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot for folks who want a good camera but are less concerned with "cool" ultra hi-tech features.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera a week and I am smitten! I am not super hi-tech and wanted a simple camera with video that could record my kids doing everyday things. This is a fantstic point and shoot camera. I love the shutter speed. It quickly takes photos so I don't miss those funny faces, etc that kids do quickly but then won't re-do for a picture. It is also very small, sleek but feels durable. This is my second in the ELPH series. They really are terrific cameras. I don't have an iphone or all those fancy gadgets but I find this camera easy to use, very functional and budget friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie Harvey

customer_reviews.title: It is a Canon and it appears that name still rules!
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the camera much but the results when used turned out to be better than expected. This from a person who has no expertise and cannot be used as an authority. I have owned a number of Canon cameras and I am yet to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RitzvilleBarry

customer_reviews.title: Excellant camera
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot Elph has proven to be all that it was advertised to be. The pictures are excellent, the high def video looks great on my high def TV on playback. The only down side is the battery life. I have just ordered a second battery to be able to have one ready for when I need it. I am very happy with the quality of the pictures and videos that I can take.
customer_reviews.author: weave

customer_reviews.title: perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: Got this for myself as an early Christmas gift and love it..the color is great, the zoom is amazing, and the screen on the back to view your pics/videos is really big. For the first time I was able to get good pics and videos at my girl's Christmas concert! Plus the compact size makes it easy to carry with me when I want. My mom and my sister have the same camera but with the 8x optical zoom. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Product exceeds expectations. It has a very handy size as it fits up in a pocket of pants. Despite being a low cost camera, presenting the features are incredible. I'm still learning how to handle it but what little I've found but looks like a great camera which I recommend widely
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've had Canon cameras in the past (even an ELPH) and really liked them. Wouldn't recommend this camera
customer_reviews.text: It took decent (not great) pictures for six months. Then, it got a lens error and stopped working immediately. I've had Canon cameras in the past (even an ELPH) and really liked them. Wouldn't recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Canon gets it right at right price point
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a camera that can give me high quality prints. This does. I been looking for a camera that transitions quickly between one shot and the next. This does. I'm still learning to use all of the features, but at this point it does everything I need as well as being compact and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: agehner

customer_reviews.title: Camera breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Camera fell off of a low chair by accident and the battery compartment lid cracked making the camera unusable for our entire vacation. very poor engineering design and a very ,very fragile lid.
customer_reviews.author: rogergaby

customer_reviews.title: great price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had the ELPH cameras for the past ten years and recently bought this camera for a great deal on amazon for a friend who is having a destination wedding. I have always been please with the use friendliness of the camera and the quality of pictures, and will buy this camera again!
customer_reviews.author: NewfoundlandHandmade

customer_reviews.title: Point, shoot, done.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Small, light, easy to carry. Fast & easy to use. Reasonably intuitive interface. Nice stabilization software. Great battery life Cons: Could boot up a bit quicker. LCD inaccurately displays noise in photos that isn't there.
customer_reviews.author: MBO

customer_reviews.title: ... bought an Olympus and while the pictures could be great, I seemed to have too many blurry pics
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Olympus and while the pictures could be great, I seemed to have too many blurry pics. I'm sure it was my fault. So I bought the Cannon, my second, and my pictures are never blurry! The high pixel count lets me crop pictures as much as I want to make photo books. I am happy!
customer_reviews.author: Wadie

customer_reviews.title: Good pictures
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the camera. I'm still learning all the bells and whistles, but the Auto settling is fine for most snapshots. I have taken pictures of our clubs Christmas party, an outside wedding, Christmas lights in the neighborhood. The best shots I've taken has been of birds - sharp and clear even when zoomed to the max.
customer_reviews.author: Delly

customer_reviews.title: Works for me

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 520 HS 10.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Full HD Video Recording (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe Canon 6169B001 PowerShot ELPH 520 HS 10.1MP Ultra-Thin Compact Digital Camera, in black, is a mere 0.76 inches thick and the world's thinnest 12x zoom camera. Canon's pursuit of perfection has driven the development of miniaturization including a lens and 10.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor that, powered by Canon's DIGIC 5 Image Processor, create images as breathtakingly beautiful as the camera itself. The camera's 12x Optical Zoom and 28mm Wide-Angle Lens is a marvel of optical technology. The Wide-Angle lens gives you more to work with in every shot, adding depth, perspective and grandeur as called for. The camera's sensor was specifically designed for this lens, so even at the long end of the zoom images are bright and clear. It is also packed with the technologies including Smart AUTO with Face ID and Full HD Video. Brimming with a full range of advanced technologies the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS digital camera makes the ultimate style icon incredibly effortless.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Canon Elph 520 HS An Ultra-Slim High Performer

In the twelve years since the original ELPH was instantly and universally proclaimed an icon of style, successive ELPH cameras have remained at the forefront of design even while boasting the very latest in digital technology. Now, opening a new era of ELPH design, the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS digital camera is both homage to the original ELPH and astonishing synthesis of Canon’s leadership in technical advancements. A mere 0.76 inches thick, it is the world’s thinnest 12x zoom camera. Canon’s pursuit of perfection has driven the development of new miniaturization including a new lens and new 10.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor that, powered by Canon’s DIGIC 5 Image Processor, create images as breathtakingly beautiful as the camera itself. It’s also packed with the latest Canon technologies including Smart AUTO with new Face ID and Full HD Video.

Spectacular Lens Power, Amazingly Compact Body

Incredibly Thin Design
Canon’s unwavering commitment to equipping an ultra-thin, clean-profiled ELPH with 12x zooming power required a redesign of the lens, sensor and other technologies. This pursuit of perfection paid off, creating the world’s thinnest camera* with a 12x zoom. At an astonishingly thin 0.76 inches, it is significantly slimmer than competitors’ 12x zoom models.


12x Optical Zoom and 28mm Wide-Angle Lens
Newly designed to custom-fit the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS digital camera’s incredibly thin profile, the camera’s 12x Optical Zoom and 28mm Wide-Angle Lens is a marvel of optical technology. The Wide-Angle lens gives you more to work with in every shot, adding depth, perspective and grandeur as called for. Landscapes, city scenes, family shots and more all benefit from the extra width. With a 12x Optical Zoom, no shot is beyond your reach. You’ll love the flexibility it gives you when shooting: from a single vantage point you can capture an unlimited number of different images simply by zooming in and out. It also incorporates the latest in Canon lens technology, suppressing lens aberration for outstanding image quality throughout the entire zoom range. The camera’s sensor was specifically designed for this lens, so even at the long end of the zoom images are bright and clear. 

UA Lens Technology
Pioneered by Canon, UA Lens technology makes possible compact lenses with remarkable optical performance. By using molded glass with an ultra-high refractive index in aspherical lens elements, Canon has succeeded in reducing lens size while significantly reducing image aberrations. Another stellar example of cutting-edge Canon optics, UA Lens technology helps make PowerShot digital cameras pocket-friendly and capable of astounding image quality. 

Canon HS SYSTEM
The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you take bright, clear photos in an even wider range of shooting situations. Beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The system is the result of two technologies brought together in PowerShot cameras: a high-sensitivity imaging sensor, which is able to capture more light; and the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, which actively reduces noise with high-speed image processing. The 10.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor in the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS digital camera incorporates advanced light reception technology that enhances sensitivity. The DIGIC 5 Image Processor provides a major boost in noise reduction, expanding the usable ISO range to an amazing high of ISO 3200. The Canon HS SYSTEM takes the frustration out of low-light shooting, delivering clear, blur-free images.


Canon Full HD Video Advantage
In addition to the Canon HS SYSTEM, the combination of the advanced CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor in the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS makes it possible to shoot crisp, clear high definition video. Imagine the fun and excitement of being able to shoot spectacular 1080p Full HD video with stereo sound that you can later watch on your HDTV or download to your computer to share with family and friends. In addition to being able to shoot Full HD 1080p video at 24* frames per second, the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS can also shoot 720p HD video at 30** frames per second. * Actual frame rate is 23.976 fps.
**Actual frame rate is 29.97 fps.


Dedicated Movie Button, Wind filter feature and Optical Zoom for easy video capture
It’s never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. The PowerShot ELPH 520 HS has a dedicated movie button that lets you start and stop recording instantly. There is no need to go through layers of menus or operate switches or dials to switch to and from video recording mode. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want. The PowerShot ELPH 520 HS also incorporates an electronic wind filter, which suppresses wind noise that can muffle or distort the sound. And unlike less sophisticated point-and-shoot cameras, the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS lets you use the full range of optical zoom when you’re shooting a video.


 

HDTV Playback via HDMI with CEC Support
It’s easy to enjoy and share the videos you shoot with the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS digital camera. Simply connect its HDMI terminal to your HDTV using an HDMI cable. And because the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS supports HDMI-CEC technology, you’ll be able to control the playback of your images and videos on any CEC-enabled HDTV using the TV’s remote control. (CEC – Consumer Electronic Control – is part of the HDMI specification, enabling components in a system to communicate with one another.)
 iFrame Movie Support 


 

 

With the PowerShot ELPH 520 HS, you can also shoot video in the Apple iFrame format, which is a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, making it more convenient to upload or e-mail high-quality videos. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, making it unnecessary to perform time-consuming and often quality-degrading conversions.


PureColor System LCD 
The PowerShot ELPH 520 HS digital camera’s large and bright 3.0-inch PureColor LCD screen makes it easy to view and frame your shots in high resolution (461,000 dots). Many LCD screens on the market today use a striped arrangement of dots that works great for text and menus, but is not ideal for imagery. The PowerShot ELPH 520 HS digital camera’s PureColor System LCD uses a delta arrangement of dots, an arrangement that works better for the organic nature of photos and videos, allowing you to review your images with exceptional clarity with rich, true-to-life color. Moreover, you can view the LCD screen over a surprisingly wide angle – above, below or to either side – without color shifts and with minimal reflections. 

Intelligent IS
The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image.
Normal
Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning
Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Hybrid
Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic
Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered
Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod
When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. 
Shooting Modes/Special Scene Modes
Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically. Movie Digest Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day’s worth of clips into a video. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Low Light
For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly-lit situations.
Portrait The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject “pop.” Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst
Captures rapid action frame by frame, by shooting continuously at a high speed while the shutter button is held down.
Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Super Vivid
Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors.
Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Underwater Capture underwater images with reduced backscatter effect. Optional Underwater Case required. Custom Define and store your own settings to achieve the effects you prefer.
Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter
Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography.
Fisheye Effect Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect
Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. 
Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
Smooth Skin
Removes dullness, wrinkles, and harsh shadows for beautiful faces.
Soft Fucus
Creates a hazy ambiance that’s perfect for portraits and wedding photos.
